subject: Re: [junit] Exception Error
msgSnippet: ... No need for src.jar on the CLASSPATH. ... No need to put them in the system classpath. They only need to be on the classpath when you launch the Java
messageBody:
>So said guddu khan on 2003-06-22 --------------------
>
>Hi,
>Problems running JUnit,
>Got to http://www.junit.org
>
>Download junit3.8.1.zip.
>Extract it to a directory.( for me it is d:\)
>Open a command prompt.
>got to the home directory of JUnit.
>for me it is d:\junit3.8.1.
>Then set the classpath as,
>
>set CLASSPATH=.;junit.jar;src.jar;%CLASSPATH%

No need for src.jar on the CLASSPATH.

>
>Then run to see whether all is set by running.
>
>java java junit.tests.AllTests
>
>Now you should see something like this:
>
>..........................................
>..........................................
>..........
>Time: 2.173
>
>OK (91 tests)
>You are all set for executing JUnit.
>Don't forget to make the junit.jar and src.jar in your
>system classpath.

No need to put them in the system classpath. They only need to be on the classpath when you launch the Java interpreter.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
